item.title: Molly White
item.description: Newsletter: Independent writers are an important facet of the media ecosystem, but a recent legal threat helps to remind me that it‚Äôs not the path for everyone.https://www.citationneeded.news/i-am-my-own-legal-department/#newsletter #CitationNeeded #journalism #IndependentMedia

item.title: Dan Gillmor
item.description: It was hard to imagine circumstances -- given the NY Times' relentlessly terrible political coverage -- that would make the Times look good this year.But then came the craven capitulations to Trump by the owners of the LA Times and Washington Post -- vetoing even milquetoast endorsements of Harris. They made the Times, which didn't duck at least that duty, seem downright brave by comparison.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: MDPI have lost their way. Or more likely never found it in the first place. h/t @deevybee I think we must conclude that paying for publication creates perverse incentives that are irresistible.But some form of the problem will remain for as long as people count publications rather than examine content. A fake paper costs 1/100th (?) of the research to produce a real one. Current incentives against low-quality production do not balance that massive factor.https://pubpeer.com/publications/77E4AB0FFADF8913053B6CE8D61085#9

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: @deevybee Until publishing crap becomes a strong career negative, we are lost.

item.title: Noah Cook
item.description: @mcnado They also made the decision *after* they had already made endorsements for House and Senate races in both Maryland and Virginia.The Post has not rescinded those endorsements or explained the difference.

item.title: ErrantScience
item.description: Gantt charts are one of the few charts that are entirely made from wishful thinking

item.title: Charlie Stross
item.description:
I love this!"One day, Linus accidentally attempted to use his hard drive to dial the university, resulting in his master boot sector starting with "ATDT" and the university modem-pool phone number. After recovering from this, he implemented file permissions in his kernel."
https://lwn.net/Articles/928581/

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: I was on PBS Newshour tonight to talk about the race to save North America‚Äôs bats from a ravaging fungus pushing them towards extinction https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/scientists-search-for-ways-to-battle-deadly-fungus-devastating-north-americas-bats

item.title: Lennart Poettering
item.description: There's a feature added to Linux 6.9 that I think people should become more aware of: there's finally an identifier for processes that doesn't wrap around as easily as UNIX pid_t PIDs do: the pidfd file descriptors have been moved onto their own proper file system (pidfs), which enabled at the same time unique inode numbers for them.

Crows are jerks.

item.title: Marc Veldhoen
item.description:
A human isolate of bovine H5N1 is transmissible and lethal in animal models2 papers. H5N1 virus derived from dairy cattle transmits by respiratory droplets in mammals without prior adaptation and causes lethal disease in animal models.https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-024-08254-7
